title: NC county wants hospital operator out as it pursues plans to reopen
text: RSS Triad Business Journal , July 8, 2015 Yadkin County officials are seeking help from federal court as they seek to reopen Yadkin Valley Community Hospital, which closed in May. In a filing in U.S. District Court on Monday, the county is asking Judge Terrance Boyle to order hospital operator HMC/CAH Consolidated of Kansas City, Mo., to immediately vacate the hospital and transfer the original hospital license and medical records to the county, as well as return any property that has been removed from the hospital. The court filing comes as county officials continue to work toward an agreement for Hugh Chatham Memorial Hospital to operate the Yadkinville hospital going forward.
